title: Mathematics 6 including Mathematics 6-7 / Math Enrichment 6 / Math Interventions 6 / Math 6-7-8 Accel
subject: Math Learning Targets

document.title: Beaverton School District 6-7th Grade Math Learning Targets

FF2DE2CC96FA40699B0C90A69EED567F.description: AST 10.10 - Compound Events : Finds probabilities of compound events using organized lists, tables, tree diagrams, and simulations.

C085174D40784D978A8A206956BA2227.description: AST 10.9 - Error Analysis : Compares probabilities from a model to observed frequencies; if the agreement is not good, explains possible sources of the discrepancy.

CF5EF6A2BB6A4C9A85BE3FB850113ECC.description: AST 10.8 - Probability Models : Develops a probability model and uses it to find probability of events.

29D00ECD1DF14E569895C56B9807D001.description: AST 10.7 - Experimental Probability : Approximates the probability of a chance event by collecting data, observing its long-run relative frequency, and predicting the approximate relative frequency.

362432D36CE14C33BD97DFCC781D3E58.description: AST 10.6 - Interpreting Probabilities : Understands that the probability of a chance event is a number between 0 and 1 that expresses the likelihood of the event occurring.

5ADC421B8DE94EF7BE6A7547694DB3D5.description: AST 10.5 - Interpreting Results : Summarizes numerical data sets in relation to their context.

DEFA45458A504B17AA58DCD0AF3EB1E4.description: AST 10.4 - Visualizing Data : Displays numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

CA877BB46B434F599595241375AE6CEF.description: AST 10.3 - Measures of Center and Spread : Recognizes that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

1FE6372793264FB3A91F5F4A68024A23.description: AST 10.2 - Center, Spread, and Shape : Understands that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

13AF36E4F58943B0B1CF04C8AC2844A0.description: AST 10.1 - Recognize Statistical Questions  :  Recognizes a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.

8CCCAF03F7934D97969D3513413CB3C2.description: ALT 10 - Statistic Variability:  Develops understanding of statistical variability and summarizes and describes distributions and investigates probability.

9CFA12A34780488D8E1F583C5079BCF5.description: AST 9.4 - Nets : Represents three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and uses the nets to find the surface area of these figures.

338BF844D570484F9B9C949497559D3D.description: AST 9.3 - Coordinate-Defined Shapes : Draws polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; uses coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

3CAB5FE347814453BDFCD57895B411C4.description: AST 9.2 - Volume of Prisms : Finds and applies the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volume of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

6E0A803DB49146DDA10F432073A886BC.description: AST 9.1 - Basic Polygons : Finds the area of triangles, quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes.

CB607E194EA84722A2A796B0C1186B14.description: ALT 9 - Area, Surface Area, and Volume:  Solves mathematical problems involving area, surface area and volume.

8F4093E8169F4C258420117E2BEE3627.description: AST 8.10 - Compound Events : Finds probabilities of compound events using organized lists, tables, tree diagrams, and simulations.

44B2B2AD344B43BEA52CC296D9794530.description: AST 8.9 - Error Analysis : Compares probabilities from a model to observed frequencies; if the agreement is not good, explains possible sources of the discrepancy.

30C48C5D640D42B5862769A8797067B9.description: AST 8.8 - Probability Models : Develops a probability model and uses it to find probability of events.

99B35C164063463A9D94425E2A6A83F8.description: AST 8.7 - Experimental Probability : Approximates the probability of a chance event by collecting data, observing its long-run relative frequency, and predicting the approximate relative frequency.

B7B80739A2774773A82BCFEECFE35E5F.description: AST 8.6 - Interpreting Probabilities : Understands that the probability of a chance event is a number between 0 and 1 that expresses the likelihood of the event occurring.

49A5BA2BB3684D3D93242A4768D860C2.description: AST 8.5 - Interpreting Results : Summarizes numerical data sets in relation to their context.

A5A0A2BAEAFB47419D15AD1667E18CF0.description: AST 8.4 - Visualizing Data : Displays numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

9F5E93680EF048519ED63078A6CC8B2E.description: AST 8.3 - Measures of Center and Spread : Recognizes that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

54E6794F81B14713BA215A32C5258FF4.description: AST 8.2 - Center, Spread, and Shape : Understands that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

0A4CFAD08D4E4325993E2582C3B5EE34.description: AST 8.1 - Recognize Statistical Questions : Recognizes a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.

C0D2B6E95BF2404D9EC890813AF1D27A.description: ALT 8 - Statistics and Probability:  Develops understanding of statistical variability, summarizes and describes distributions, and investigates probability.

1B61D50FD0364527B0CC7F85444CA286.description: AST 7.8 - Applications : Solves real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane, including the use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate and the same second coordinate.

C2193546FA834560BE2733C4633A3334.description: AST 7.7 - Ordering and Absolute Value : Understands ordering and absolute values of rational numbers.

3FFD5D056FE0454494AC450D0992AEF8.description: AST 7.6 - Rationals and Numberlines : Uses a rational number as a point on the number line.

8CA8ECD3E293407C8DE43BBDBCB7A660.description: AST 7.5 - Signed Numbers : Understands that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions and values.

4ADFAC4A8D624D2ABE867A5EF8BD8E63.description: AST 7.4 - GCF and LCD : Finds the greatest common factor and least common denominator with whole numbers and uses the distributive property.

9EFC74AE8C494752B92613C6F3CB35CE.description: AST. 7.3 - Decimal Operations : Fluently adds, subtracts, multiplies, and divides multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

8689F0A84E28436B900B0196AD8FB371.description: AST 7.2 - Fluent Division : Fluently divides multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

F0CC3C3D09234039B602B8F8E22C35FB.description: AST 7.1 - Division : Interprets and computes quotients of fractions, and solves word problems involving division of fractions by fractions by using a visual fraction model and equations to represent the problem.

D5802D998DF742D282ABD2461D355EB1.description: ALT 7 - Rational Numbers:  Computes, applies and extends previous understandings of rational numbers fluently.

740C4710477449BB8D69B77B4DC6E025.description: AST 6.3 - Applications : Uses ratios and rate reasoning to solve real-world and percent mathematical problems.

A305243AB2B44153AF6E130B240A056A.description: AST 6.2 - Unit Rates : Uses the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.

0C806C13367048D0BAC43D9A4833F640.description: AST 6.1 - Concept and Description : Uses the concepts of ratio and ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

A6060E7D1A0242F49CE4AB9A20C1EC6E.description: ALT 6 - Ratios Concepts and Reasoning:  Uses ratio concepts and ratio reasoning to solve problems.

EE3AA415D367402EAE498F39F09A4BC7.description: AST 1.9 - 2-Variable Relationships : Analyzes the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relates these to the equation.

8B57232AEA064A728DF07F908D784FB4.description: AST 1.8 - Inequalities : Writes an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem.

521C07F91AD44CBC9829042B3C3DFF1B.description: AST 1.7 - One-Step Equations : Solves real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q.

414E984E58B84FCEB532AFD0B4EE4CEC.description: AST 1.6 - Modeling : Uses variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem.

005193C3DB42424D87B900F81DECF715.description: AST 1.5 - Interpret Results : Solves equations or inequalities as a process of answering questions.

6BD09794972840CF86DF924DCAE35694.description: AST 1.4 - Equivalence : Identifies when two expressions are equivalent.

8C59064B59834CDC8603813B754709F1.description: AST 1.3 - Properties of Operations : Applies the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.

4A91C727B2424C98A295DF3A53EC3974.description: AST 1.2 - Algebraic Expressions : Writes, reads, and evaluates expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

A4F97BABAA55461982A423B59C1F5C8D.description: AST 1.1 - Exponents : Writes and evaluates numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

F658F829A1D740BD8AD68786FDBA6385.description: ALT 1 - Algebraic Equations:  Applies and reasons algebraically using expressions, one-variable equations and inequalities.
